name: Quality Hotel Wellington

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Quality Hotel for one night and were very happy with the clean, modern and spacious room. The hotel is located in a busy and vibrant part of the city and within walking distance of many excellent restaurants, bars and shops. On site covered parking was only an extra $10, and as we had booked using the Wotif website, we also received a continental breakfast voucher. My only concern was that the after hours entry at the rear of the building was down a dark alley... it was safe but I think better lighting would've made a big difference to my feeling of security.
reviews.title: Spacious and Modern

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was excellent. We didn't need a car. Everything we wanted to do was within 5 - 10mins walking distance or close to buses and frequent taxis.
reviews.title: Brand New.....has potential!

likes.liked: — Location, clean styli rooms, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Finer details were overlooked prior to hotel opening (I'm sure these would have been addressed by now)

description: In 2008 the 4 Star Plus Quality Hotel was built alongside and interconnecting with the 3 Star Plus Comfort Hotel Wellington to an award-winning standard architecture. These hotel rooms are impressive with their fresh and contemporary style and abundance of space. Complete with kitchenettes, heated indoor swimming pool and spa, roof top sun terrace, fitness room, funky bar and restaurant area and state of the art conference centre. It is ideally located amongst Wellington’s finest cafes, restaurants, bars and boutique shopping that the Cuba Quarter is famous for. Also within walking distance of the CBD, harbour, Te Papa, Westpac Stadium, TSB Arena and all of Wellington city’s major attractions.The CQ Hotels Wellington holds a Code Compliance Certificate for both its properties, including for earthquake risk. Comfort Hotel Wellington was strengthened to 100% of the code in 2004 & Quality Hotel Wellington is a new building, built in 2008.
